intro: Psilolepus pedunculatus, commonly known as the slender clubmoss, is a small evergreen shrub belonging to the family Lycopodiaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branching structure and small, scale-like leaves that are tightly packed around the stems. The plant produces spore-bearing cones, which are clustered at the ends of its branches. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Psilolepus pedunculatus is a primitive vascular plant with a long evolutionary history dating back to the Paleozoic era.
